data.title: Ok for the price
data.text: Tasty ice cream but seemed more like a coffee shop. We read about their wonderful waffle cones but they were out of them. One scoop in a bowl with add ins was $3. A good value.

data.title: Great quality food....fast and courteous service plus reasonable cost
data.text: The Crema is a small but delightfully restaurant in downtown Raleigh service straight and blended coffees, sandwiches, soups, great shakes and ice cream.  Crema gives small businesses a good name! Sort of New York friend in personality but a never-the-less a pleasant cook, restaurateur and owner. Also, the location is easy to get too!

data.title: Grandkids loved the ice cream!
data.text: The grandkids loved the ice cream with two additional items added. It could be more ice cream or toppings. They had quite a selection of flavors and toppings to choose  from.

data.title: Great Place for Quick Take-Out
data.text: This review is for the City Plaza location which has recently been expanded and renovated. I don't drink coffee, but I often pick up lunch from Crema. This is a small shop that offers soups, salads, sandwiches, and a breakfast menu in addition to coffee and ice cream. The marinated tomato & brie sandwich is very good. The ingredients always seem fresh and the bread is delicious. The poppy seed salad is very good as well with mixed greens, nuts, craisins, and goat cheese. On my last visit I got a half poppy seed salad and cup of creamy squash soup which was perfect on a chilly day. For a quick take-out lunch, you can't beat this place!

data.title: Great Ice Cream!
data.text: I usually don't bother to buy ice cream because I make my own, but this was better than I can do PLUS they make their own Waffle cones! Don't hesitate to try some.

data.title: Delight to the Taste Buds!
data.text: was expecting a scoop of ice-cream with the add-ons thrown in and was deliciously surprised to have it all 'mixed' in/blenderinzed.. so creamy and yummy!

data.title: Lunch time regular
data.text: I am a regular visitor for lunch here.  You order at the counter and wait for the food.  I recently had the Poppy Seed Salad (my absolute favorite), the tomato and brie sandwich and the chicken salad croissant.  They also have a homemade cucumber salad that is a must have.  If you go around lunch time be prepared to wait.  The line will be long, but worth it in the end.

data.title: Very poor customer service and owner was extremely rude
data.text: The drink was poorly made by the actual owner.  He aggressively withdrew the drink from my hand, and conversed with angry tone. I felt offended and disrespected. I will no longer attend this place for services.

data.title: lunch
data.text: Crema is a place where  you order from a somewhat limited sandwich board and eat at one of the tables. Sandwiches are good but nothing special.

data.title: Pick Chocolate or Vanilla Ice Cream and add in your own Mix-ins
data.text:
Many combinations to be had here. Just pick Chocolate or Vanilla soft serve as your base and then add in up to three mix-ins. I had chocolate with raspberry, blueberries and cookie dough. They pretty much blend it all in together for you to create your own personal ice cream flavor. 

It hit the spot.

data.title: Great homemade ice cream
data.text: I ordered chocolate mint chip and they created it with a vanilla base (my choice) and chocolate chips and mint chips.  Excellent   Five of us ordered different dishes and all were quite pleased.

data.title: Ice Cream!
data.text: Only thing I had was the ice cream but it was so good! I had no idea the coffee shop did this. So you pick an ice cream: chocolate or vanilla, then pick three toppings: I picked pineapple, mango, banana, then choose whether you want it all in a cup or waffle cone. Then they mix it all together in this machine; so I got chocolate ice cream with little chunks of the fruit in it. It’s reminiscent of a McFlurry at McDonalds, where they blend all the ingredients together. Had no idea this was here. Good little snack to interrupt my work day :)

data.title: Coffee shop in the lobby
data.text: This is basically a coffee stand in the lobby of drab office building.  Not sure why it's listed as an attraction in Raleigh.

data.title: Just a hot chocolate review
data.text:
I'm not much of a coffee drinker, however do love a good hot chocolate in the wintertime.  I have frequented this place on occasion and their hot chocolate is tasty.  

I would say Royal Bean on Hillsborough St has a better taste, however if downtown and looking for a hot chocolate, this will serve its purpose.

data.title: What a find!
data.text: Stopped by in a pinch (Carolina bakery is closed on Sat!!!) And found a gem. Had two little ones with us and everyone loved the sandwiches. I had Reuban n hot, melty cheese and my sister had chicken salad on croissant. Both were excellent and good portion. Stayed for ice cream.... And would come back for both! Cute, funky place. Will definitely come back!

data.title: Delicious!
data.text:
I went for Ice cream and sandwiches. The ice cream was very tasty and a great variety of choices. The place smells wonderful, you can tell they serve coffee! Sandwiches were great too, a bit expensive but being that not many restaurant places are open in the weekend in that area, I can understand they want to make a good use of that situation.
I loved the fact that they use/serve great quality products.

data.title: Solid "healthy" cafe
data.text:
A coffee, smoothies, sandwich cafe. On the street right down from Union/Capitol Square so real convenient to that location. Their chicken salad had nuts so I got the BLT. It was fine, not too messy, served with choice of chips or cucumber salad. I took the latter and it was a nice surprise. They also have wine. He suggested I add another fruit to my raspberry smoothie to reduce tartness. Good idea, although I'm used to and love raspberries plain. My husband had an egg cream and must have been good cause I didn't hear complaints.
  Nice view of the walkers and storefronts.
  It was a nice quick fix after seeing the Capitol and before we headed out of Raleigh on flight home. It looks to be many restaurants in the area.

data.title: Coffee shop where the ice cream shines.
data.text: I'm not a coffee drinker, and I am convinced I never will be. There are signs in the establishment itself claiming that this is one of the best locations of roasting coffee beans in the triangle. Or something of the like. I don't know if this is true, I can't really attest to that. This little cafe has a great location on Fayetteville street. They serve sandwiches, pastries, coffee and tea. I would ignore all of that. They serve delicious ice cream. They have many unique options to mix into your ice cream. It is probably one of the ice cream places we rate highest in Raleigh.

data.title: Best ice cream ever. Wide selection of flavors (37) and you can combine any of them to make your own! Iced coffee, ice...
data.text: Best ice cream ever. Wide selection of flavors (37) and you can combine any of them to make your own! Iced coffee, ice cream, sweet treat.
